file_content.text: Those Victor Squadron pilots were born for the cockpit. Looking over their flight data... it's inspiring.
I have the flight recorders from Victor Squadron.
Ah, good. Hope the Republic didn't give you too much trouble. They can be possessive.
I'll have my people start going over the data immediately. We'll pass on our findings as soon as we find something.
Looking forward to getting a peek at those flight recorders.
A Sith? My, these frozen wastes produce such... interesting guests. But please, stay awhile.
Hmm. You don't have the cut of an EDF officer. Joined the Imperials, then?
You must be freezing. Please, stay awhile. Warm yourself up.
You must be cold, coming all this way. Stay awhile, I insist. Warm yourselves.
I'm Captain Yunaali, Hammer Squadron. Call sign's "Blue Mother." Organizing a joint training op for our pilots.
Been digging through these old hulls for research material. Slow going, but I want our people learning from the best.
Even if our people train together, don't delude yourself into thinking we're equals, Captain.
Remember who's in charge.
How could I forget, my lord?
You can learn much from the dead.
I like your methods.
Or their ships.
Maybe you should spend less time scrounging and more time flying.
Quit rifling through junk.
Running combat maneuvers will only take you so far. We need to understand how the enemy thinks, how they fly.
No shortage of abandoned spacecraft on Hoth.
You picked a good spot.
Precisely.
Smart.
Joint training? Sounds risky.
Oh, there'll be the usual swaggering and chest-thumping, but we all know who the common enemy is.
I'm particularly interested in Victor Squadron. Finest pilots the Republic ever produced. Nearly took half the Imperial armada down with them.
Our scouts have located what's left of their ships. Fighters are mostly scrap, but some of the internal components are still intact.
I'm surprised the cold didn't ruin everything.
It's not all frozen?
Good thing we're only after the flight recorders. Those things are built to withstand anything.
You think there's something of value in those ships?
What kind of components?
Information. It's likely the ships' flight recorders are functional.
Internal components? Boring.
Most of the parts are useless or boring, yes. But the flight recorders--those are the real prize.
Those recorders contain a detailed log of Victor Squadron's missions. Analyzing that data could give us valuable insight into the Republic's flight tactics.
Unfortunately, the Republic has already mobilized to recover the flight recorders. Someone needs to beat them to the punch.
I'll do it.
Can't you do it?
We're not authorized to engage the Republic directly. If there's any blood to be spilt, it can't be on Chiss hands.
The crash site isn't far. Recon has confirmed a Republic presence already in the area, so watch your tail.
Won't be me. [Refuse quest]
I hope you'll reconsider. We may not get a chance like this again.
Marvelous planet, this. A frozen monument to one of the greatest space battles ever.
